User Credentials¶

SALTS uses the following class to handle user credentials. Once initialized, the data stored in it can’t be changed.

class src.credentials.credentials_manager.UserCredentials(_user_dict: dict)¶

Stores information about the current user.

Parameters:

_user_dict – The dict that the object will pull its information from. It must have the following keys: id, fName, lName, loc, dept, and title.

validate()¶

Checks all of the information entered for a user for validity.

More information on the checks can be found on the Validation Checks page.

Raises:

Exception – If one of the fields is invalid or missing, or if there are too many fields provided.

name()¶
Returns:

The user’s first and last name, e.g. “Kara Lynch”.

Return type:

str

first_name()¶
Returns:

The user’s first name, e.g. “Kara”.

Return type:

str

last_name()¶
Returns:

The user’s last name, e.g. “Lynch”.

Return type:

str

employee_id()¶
Returns:

The user’s employee ID number, e.g. 263.

Return type:

int

location()¶
Returns:

The user’s country of residence, e.g. “United States”.

Return type:

str

department()¶
Returns:

The department the user works in, e.g. “Legal”.

Return type:

str

title()¶
Returns:

The user’s job title, e.g. “Aide”.

Return type:

str

is_manager()¶
Returns:

True if the user is a manager, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

has_license_auth()¶
Returns:

True if the user is a manager of IT or Legal (i.e. the user has the authority to edit license records), False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
